summary: This bill, the IRS Accountability and Taxpayer Protection Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the procedural rules for penalties assessed by the IRS and disallowance periods. It requires supervisory approval for penalties and defines 'initial determination.' The bill also mandates a public report from the Treasury Secretary detailing IRS penalty assessments. Furthermore, it clarifies disallowance periods for various tax credits and outlines the effective dates of the amendments.
